intro: Urostigma acamptophyllum, commonly known as the narrow-leaved urostigma, is a member of the Apiaceae family, characterized by its aromatic foliage and umbellate inflorescences. It is a perennial herb that typically grows in moist, woodland habitats, often found in the eastern United States. The plant has finely divided, fern-like leaves that are often covered in a dense layer of fine hairs. Its small white or pale yellow flowers are clustered in umbrella-shaped clusters, which attract various pollinators. Urostigma acamptophyllum is known for its medicinal properties and has been used traditionally in herbal remedies.
